top_comments.comment:
An error with the documentary is that it spends too much time covering remote communities. It should've been made more relevant to the people who'd typically watch the video. As the delayers and science deniers often view climate change as something that happens only in distant countries and that impacts to their own regions will only be long into the future.
With populations in India and Bangladesh having the highest levels of acceptance, of the reality of the climate crisis, of all countries in the world.
Global warming is the least of our concerns at this point in time within this ‘The Generation of the Fig Tree’.
Earth will always sustain itself one way or another
Rising temperatures are real but you are comparing with a baseline about 150 years ago when the earth was still in a mini ice age.

comments_since_last_sample.body: Cop26 is a vital step for mankind..its now or never-develop nation should stop CO2 emissions at zero level..
We had these temperatures in the middle ages. 900AD to about 1300 AD. .

Where I live normally winter last 6 months or did for my 1st 30 years of life. During last 20 years winter has last around 5 months and during that 5 month could have so warm weeks that it have been like a spring middle of winter.
The world is behaving strangely lately, here in Johannesburg South Africa we had two small earthquakes in last 4 months, first time experiencing it in 45 years....
No 3° will not be the end.
A lot of it is down to overpopulation. Contraception is the answer
Too many humans is the single biggest problem. Not the only problem - but the single biggest problem. Why aren't world leaders and middle class virtue signallers talking about *that*?
Rising temperatures are real but you are comparing with a baseline about 150 years ago when the earth was still in a mini ice age.
